meanings.definition: Existing or occurring before the development of technology.
meanings.sent1: The ancient civilization had a pretechnological way of life.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed pretechnological tools used by early humans.
meanings.sent3: The pretechnological methods of communication seem so quaint now.
meanings.sent4: In the pretechnological era, survival relied on manual labor and basic tools.
meanings.sent5: The pretechnological world was filled with simplicity and natural beauty.

meanings.definition: Relating to a time before the use of technology.
meanings.sent1: The pretechnological village relied on farming and hunting for sustenance.
meanings.sent2: The book described a pretechnological society living in harmony with nature.
meanings.sent3: The pretechnological approach to transportation involved horses and carriages.
meanings.sent4: Her pretechnological mindset made her appreciate the simplicity of life.
meanings.sent5: The pretechnological era was marked by a deep connection to the land.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a lack of technological advancements.
meanings.sent1: The pretechnological region had limited access to modern conveniences.
meanings.sent2: The pretechnological culture valued craftsmanship over automation.
meanings.sent3: Living in a pretechnological society meant relying on manual labor.
meanings.sent4: The pretechnological world was untouched by the rapid pace of technological progress.
meanings.sent5: Their pretechnological lifestyle emphasized self-sufficiency and community bonds.
